title: How to Be an Effective Teammate in Halo 3

steps.headline: Have a 'mic' for communication.
steps.description: One of the most crucial steps in being a teammate is having a mic to talk over Xbox Live. If you don't have a mic it is almost impossible to be an effective teammate.

steps.headline: Find a group of players you know and can have fun with.
steps.description: If you're having fun and can talk casually with your team you will perform much better.

steps.headline: Make sure that all of your team is on your skill level, or that they understand you are not on their skill level but are trying hard to get there.
Start with playing in Team Slayer, something like an MLG playlist can be much more difficult and need even better teamwork.
Make a plan.
steps.description: Talk with your teammates and decide on a plan of action. Plan things like what areas of the map you want to control and where each member of the team needs to be to achieve control.

steps.headline: Listen to the players around you and be aware of your surroundings.
steps.description: Otherwise you will frequently caught off guard, and killed as the dismay of your teammates.

steps.headline: A key strategy is using "callouts" these are just simple names for areas around the map for quick reference.
steps.description: Ex: "They have two guys in red base!"

steps.headline: Listen to your teammates callouts, even if you do not believe them or they are wrong.
steps.description: It really is better to be safe then sorry, especially in a tight game.

steps.headline: Use your strengths to your advantage.
steps.description: Find who on your team is the best snipers, slayers, and supporters are and embrace your rolls. If you are not strong in close quarters combat, DON'T RUSH at the other team.

steps.headline: After games, whether they are wins or losses, be sure to talk about it with your team.
steps.description: Go over what you did well, what you did wrong, and ways you can improve as a team.

text: Have a 'mic' for communication. One of the most crucial steps in being a teammate is having a mic to talk over Xbox Live. If you don't have a mic it is almost impossible to be an effective teammate. Find a group of players you know and can have fun with. If you're having fun and can talk casually with your team you will perform much better. Make sure that all of your team is on your skill level, or that they understand you are not on their skill level but are trying hard to get there.  Start with playing in Team Slayer, something like an MLG playlist can be much more difficult and need even better teamwork.  Make a plan. Talk with your teammates and decide on a plan of action. Plan things like what areas of the map you want to control and where each member of the team needs to be to achieve control. Listen to the players around you and be aware of your surroundings. Otherwise you will frequently caught off guard, and killed as the dismay of your teammates. A key strategy is using "callouts" these are just simple names for areas around the map for quick reference. Ex: "They have two guys in red base!" Listen to your teammates callouts, even if you do not believe them or they are wrong. It really is better to be safe then sorry, especially in a tight game. Use your strengths to your advantage. Find who on your team is the best snipers, slayers, and supporters are and embrace your rolls. If you are not strong in close quarters combat, DON'T RUSH at the other team. After games, whether they are wins or losses, be sure to talk about it with your team. Go over what you did well, what you did wrong, and ways you can improve as a team.
